            Bio
            Frank Hermosillo studies neural networks and their
            applications at Google Brain. His research focuses on
            differentiable network pruning approximation and
            decentralized gradient inversion mechanics. He frequently
            collaborates with researchers who study machine learning,
            computer vision, and cognitive science. His work has been
            featured in WIRED, The Atlantic, Newsweek, and The New York
            Times Magazine.
            
            
            Education
            Massachusetts Institute of Technology |
            Cambridge, MA
            Ph.D. in Computer Science | September 2009 - May 2014
            The University of California, Berkeley |
            Berkeley, CA
            B.S. in Computer Science | September 2005 - May 2009
            
            
            Experience
            Google Brain | Principal Investigator |
            January 2018 - Present
            Netflix | Research Scientist | June 2014
            - December 2017

articles.title: Matthew Son
articles.description: This is description of the homepage.
articles.contents:
Matthew Son's Website
          
          
          Home
          Research
          Teaching

              Matthew Son
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                         GitHub

                        CV
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            Welcome!
            I’m a Ph.D. candidate in Finance at the University of
            Florida, and expected to finish the program in 2023. I’ll be
            on the job market this year. My research interest includes
            Big data/Maching Learning in Finance, FinTech, Derivative
            securities, Market microstructure and Mutual funds.
            I taught Financial Modeling course that introduces
            various modern technologies including object-oriented
            programming, automation techniques and machine learning. I
            was chosen as Award winner of Ph.D Excellence in Teaching in
            Warrington College of Business.
            
            
            
            Education
            University of Florida, Gainesville, FL
            
            Ph.D. in Finance  | 2023
            (Expected)
            
            University of Alberta, Edmondton, AB
            
            M.A. in Economics and Finance  |
            2018 
            
            Korea University, Seoul, Korea
            
            B.A. in Economics  | 2011 
            
            
            B.Sc. in Public Health  | 2011
